documents.document: @LloydBurr @WillimentNZ How is it worth nearly $4k if it doesn't include flights?!
It's the small things we do rather than say - so I have donated $$, I will no longer user Uber, & I've signed up to help new refugees in NZ.
It's interesting how quickly friendships change. Looking at who I invited to my 30th, half of those wouldn't make the invite list this year.
@embellishnz Around 7 hours, with a couple of small breaks/snapchat opportunities! Very sore feet today though!
When people say that "policies don't matter" when it comes to elections & politics, may I politely invite you to look at the USA right now.
So it turns out that you can walk from Featherston to Upper Hutt. It's 45km and sweet baby Jesus your feet will hurt at the end.
Jesus, $22 for a return train from Wgtn to Featherston this Saturday. Way to encourage people to explore the country using public transport!
Yup, reschedule in four year's time when that muppet is no longer in the White House. https://t.co/14wuZp8EHk
@emmawehipeihana @zaichishka Who then cry foul by saying regulations/new rules are costing them more. The though of selling doesn't occur.
If Obama was the Yes We Can President, Trump is the No, You Can't President. No, You Can't stay here. No, You Can't have healthcare.
Honestly, holding insurance in an apartment block is just a back & forth as to who should pay between contents insurer & building insurer.
I always thought those competitions where you win a car were a complete scam, but then my friend's dad won one!
My best mate made a 13 pg document for our walk this wknd. Hopefully that means we won't get lost (famous last word… https://t.co/zIQGIONqOh
@filingfreak Map shows a 10km walk to trains, we're ok with that, as long as it can be done and we're not on the motorway!
Has anyone walking the Rimutaka Rail Trail from Featherston to Upper Hutt? How was it? Easy enough to get to/from trains either end?
Today I ran into an ex I haven't seen in 15 years or so. I was looking fine as. First time that's happened!
Escaped Wgtn in an attempt to find sun but I just ended up bringing the unideal summer weather with me. Sorry, Hawke's Bay!
I'm at the playground with my nephew. I've kept him alive, fed, and unhurt for 20 hours so far. Maybe I'm now ready for a pet. Maybe.
@paulmcee It's like people complaining about a lettuce shortage in June! People be crazy.
"It's on special" #3wordsbetterthaniloveyou
Perhaps the #weatherbomb may have been overegged somewhat when I have friends in the UK asking if I'm ok while outside the sun is shining.
My sister is allowing me to look after my 4 year old nephew on my own for 24 hours this wknd. I'm nervous.
@BenThomasNZ Only if it is Lassie or Beethoven. Or Air Bud. Every other dog is fair game.
@BenThomasNZ BEN - THIS IS WHAT SNAPSHOT STORIES WERE MADE FOR!
@BenThomasNZ I think it's best that you snapchat your US experience for us. Thank you muchly!
Uh guys? There's an 'apple shortage' bc it's January. New NZ apples don't start until early Feb. Instead, eat & enjoy all the stonefruit!
@nzsecretsanta Maybe NZSS is what kicks off the START of Christmas - i.e. Nov to buy/sleuth/send, with gifts arriving on 1/12? It may help?
@nzsecretsanta Would you consider sharing some of the suggestions and asking the NZSS community to vote on them?
I adore Wellington, but the combination of sunshine, school holidays, & a cruise ship means it takes 12x longer to get anywhere/do anything.
@katieabradford I have done that too - and viber group messages! The lengths we go to, huh?!
Reason #146 for having a flatmate: advice on what outfit to wear to a wedding. If you're playing along at home, outfit #6 was the winner.
Can someone invent a 'blocked words' app for newsites? This month, my key blocked stories would involve "rugby, wedding, diets, cricket"
In an attempt to be more money-conscious this year, I've just unfollowed all brands/shops/places that want me to spend money. It's a start!
Good lord Hawke's Bay. Don't replace one incompetent MP with another one who more than proved his incompetence last year. Please. I beg you.
Haven't made it to the beach yet this summer. And with the Wellington weather we're having, doesn't look like it will happen anytime soon!
@timfuckinhoward This is true! It's so good, right - I always have a wee chuckle to myself!
@timfuckinhoward If it was me and I didn't see you - I apologise, I wasn't wearing my glasses!
This is inspiring. Supportive friends family, and colleagues would be a must though! https://t.co/BLC2myJ6H3
@timfuckinhoward NO! It is the end of the week!
Also. Calendars should begin on a Monday. Grrrr on those who insist on putting Sunday at the beginning.
So my colleagues want to start doing walk/work/talks. I suggested they call it a hīkōrero (hīkoi + kōrero). Kinda proud of that effort!
This summer break, at the age of nearly 33, I finally figured out what I want to do with my life. Now to get started!
And that's me out for 2016. https://t.co/J0rDLAUIRp
It's a travesty that the soundtracks to the Sister Act movies are not on iTunes or Spotify.
So I just bought myself a diamond and sapphire ring at a jewellery auction. For less than what I was prepared to pay. #treatyourself
At my first auction. After I send this tweet I will be sitting on my hands so I don't accidentally buy all of the things.
Just heard a teenage girl describe a boy as a "superior being". Jeez, compliments have improved since I was young!
@ryaninnz I did indeed :) It's all a bit of trial and error but hoping I'm on the right track.
Ticked another item off the Adulting 101 checklist - I purchased managed funds today. And yet, I still ate chocolate for dinner last night.
@BeezilBeard Ohmygosh I hear you on that one. I'm lacking it this week, after being full of it a couple of weeks ago!
@BeezilBeard Ohymygosh I'm so glad you made yourself known - thank you, thank you :)
If I buy myself a diamond ring at a jewelry auction tomorrow, will that help improve the grinchy Christmas feels I currently have?
@johnpagani It's 8.14pm in Paris. Why is there not a glass (bottle) of vino on the table? You've changed.....
@johnpagani Impatient! Also, aren't you supposed to be globetrotting around the world right now?!
What a lovely way to start the week #nzsecretsanta thank you 😘- now don't mind me, I'm off to spend the rest of the… https://t.co/oDOXtvYaht

Ooooh my #nzsecretsanta gift is here!
*makes self a cup of tea and settles in for the excitement of opening*
July Amy showed a lot of foresight for Dec Amy in booking a six day tramp in the bush over New Years with no reception, or people I know.
But, but - no #nzsecretsanta delivery today. I wait in antici.......pation for Monday.
@WendyWings My 2015 one outed herself to me, and she's fabulous. Would still love to know who my epic 2014 gifter was, they were rad!
It's sunny, it's our work Xmas party, good friends are arriving for the wknd, AND it's #nzsecretsanta day! Bring on the awesomeness of today
Do any of you check in with your #nzsecretsanta from previous years? Or mutually follow each other? Became friends IRL? Or lovers even?!
Excellent news. Was absolutely incompetent with the Havelock North water crisis. So many people unhappy with him! https://t.co/AzHzDt3pC4
I'm doing it. I'm canceling my appearance at family Christmases. Gonna stay in Wgtn & do my own thing - champagne and a book at the park.
@ElaineLHutt I also think calling him a man may have been too kind. Creature of the deep is probably more like it.
Had a *delightful* man call me a slut several times while I walked down the road in my gym gear. What a way to start the day!
Sometimes I think I'm winning at adulthood, but then I have a bag of twisties & plastic cheese for dinner and the illusion is over.
@juliefairey @Jess_McAllen We had one too. When I was the guest speaker at prizegiving in 2013, it came out of me like no time had passed.
@juliefairey @Jess_McAllen Ohmygosh this one just come rushing back to me in a heartbeat! And the Lord's Prayer (not a hymn, but ingrained)
Sometimes I wish you could like emails, as we do with tweets.
@katieabradford I think it's only right that you share these reasons. Spreading joy, and all that....
1. Saw original cast of Hamilton on Broadway 2. Spent the best 4 wks with @Crystallionzz & @NiqCurry in USA 3. Debt… https://t.co/5i6u09PuL2
My mum just sent me a pxt & life update (kids + success + wealth) of her with my high school boyfriend at an event. I just....why?!!!
Who was the genius that decided we stopped needing a nap once we left kindergarten? Reinstate the afternoon nap for all!
Honestly, sometimes I think political commentators will never be content until they themselves are situated on the 9th floor.
Work Christmas party, three good friends coming to visit for the wknd, sunshine, and it's #nzsecretsanta - what a week this is going to be!
Trying to convince my yoga teacher that we should all be sipping from mini bottles of champagne in our final class of the year.
@SimonAshbyNZ Trust me when I say you're not one of those aforementioned parents!
Startling realisation: it isn't babies or kids I don't have time for - it's their super annoying parents!
Sometimes I just like to watch clips from Whose Line is it Anyway to laugh out loud and lose myself in all the funny.
Got home. Made lolly cake. Sorted out six large bags of clothing/household items to donate to the refuge for Christmas. Feeling virtuous 😇
While shaking hands after our social netball game today, one of the opp players shook the hand of our A and called her a 'stroppy b**ch'!
@irishkiwi09 So many people have though! So if mine has, I can match it and thank my Santa personally & also hopefully make a new friend!
Thought: take screenshots of all #nzsecretsanta wrapped gift tweets sent so far so when it's here I can easily sleuth to figure out my Santa
If you'd told me at high school that I would be the captain of TWO netball teams at age 32, my uncoordinated self wouldn't have believed it.
The snarkiness from opposition MPs & others about the Nats that are putting their name forward is unnecessary. Sometimes being quiet is best
Can't help but feel sorry for those of the PM's staff that will have to start looking for jobs over the holiday period. Merry Christmas?
I've found so many neat #nzsecretsanta that I've followed in the last few weeks - it's one of my favourite parts of playing!
I am going to spend all of today reading a great book and eating homemade cookies while listening to the #HamiltonMixtape - perfection 😍
Having one family Secret Santa on Mum's side, one on Dad's side, and no partner or kids makes Christmas shopping an absolute breeze for me!
I'm with you on that one. The videos that play automatically on news stories are grrrrr inducing. https://t.co/U8g8WsNURc
@WhittakersNZ Eight...which is six more than I have in my desk drawer currently!
Three toenails are still black from the 50km I did 3 weeks ago, but it hasn't stopped me signing up today for my next event - 36km in April!
@CTrevettNZH @robhosking Ooooh yes. Also, where are you guys now that Gallery is a no-go?
@robhosking I don't know what's come over me this year. I can't explain it. It's new. And weird. And very un-Amy!
Christmas carols are playing in the office, decorations go up in my apartment this wknd, and #nzsecretsanta gifts h… https://t.co/1R7pAMmCCw
@timfuckinhoward Camping out each night. Carrying all my own gear. If I did, I think I'd want to do it as a team, for moral support!
A friend suggested I look at this race for 2018. It's 301km long, spread over 7 days. Intense. And crazy insane. https://t.co/TzG2R1UZJs
Wrapped all of my #nzsecretsanta gifts individually. Not a good idea when my wrapping looks as though I did it with one hand, blindfolded.
@andlehay @ShoreGirlyGirl @WendyWings I get that 'everyone should be able to play', but seriously. Some people should just not be allowed.
My income this year has only gone to five places: 1. Mortgage 2. Savings accounts 3. Moore Wilsons 4. Kathmandu 5. Sporting endeavours
